ray.rage.scene

Interface SceneObject

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Disposable, Managed<SceneManager>, Nameable, Visible
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    Camera, Entity, Light, ManualObject, SkeletalEntity, SkyBox, Tessellation
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractGenericSceneObject, GenericCamera, GenericEntity, GenericLight, GenericManualObject, GenericSkeletalEntity, GenericSkyBox, GenericTessellation

    public interface SceneObject
extends Nameable, Visible, Managed<SceneManager>, Disposable
    A scene object is an object that can be placed in a scene by getting attached to a scene-node.

    Scene objects don't have any information about a scene, such as a position or a rotation. Rather, they rely on scene-nodes for it.

    Author:
    Raymond L. Rivera
    See Also:
    SceneNode

      static interface  SceneObject.Listener
      Listener for scene-object-related events.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Gets the name used to identify this instance. In this case, the name of this scene-object.
        Specified by:
        getName in interface Nameable
        Returns:
        The name of this scene-object.

      • getParentNode

        Node getParentNode()
        Gets the scene-node to which this scene-object is attached, if any, as a regular node.
        Returns:
        The parent node, if any. Otherwise null.

      • getParentSceneNode

        SceneNode getParentSceneNode()
        Gets the scene-node to which this scene-object is attached, if any.
        Returns:

      • notifyAttached

        void notifyAttached(SceneNode parent)
        Notifies this scene-object that it has been attached to a parent scene-node.

        If this scene-object is already attached, then it's responsible for detaching itself from its current parent before attaching itself to the new one.

        The listeners must be invoked before the old parent is discarded and after the new one assigned, so that listeners can see who the old parent originally was and who the new parent currently is.

        WARNING: This method is meant to be used internally by the framework and not by game clients. Use directly only if you really know what you're doing.

        Parameters:
        parent - The scene-node to which this scene-object has been attached.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the parent is null.
        See Also:
        detachFromParent(), getParentNode(), getParentSceneNode()

      • notifyDetached

        void notifyDetached()
        Lets this scene-object know that it has been detached from its parent scene-node.

        If a listener has been set, then this method is responsible for calling SceneObject.Listener.onObjectDetached(SceneObject). If this scene-object is already detached, then it does nothing.

        The listener must be invoked before the new parent has been assigned, so that scene-objects listening in can see who the previous parent used to be.

        WARNING: This method is meant to be used internally by the framework and not by game clients. Use directly only if you really know what you're doing.

        See Also:
        notifyAttached(SceneNode), getParentNode(), getParentSceneNode()

      • isAttached

        boolean isAttached()
        Determines if this scene-object is attached to a scene-node or not.
        Returns:
        True if this scene-object is attached to a scene-node. Otherwise false.
        See Also:
        isInScene()

      • detachFromParent

        void detachFromParent()
        Causes this scene-object to detach itself from its parent scene-node, if attached.

        The scene-object is responsible for invoking SceneNode.detachObject(SceneObject).

      • isInScene

        boolean isInScene()
        Determines if this scene-object is in the scene or not.

        For this scene-object to be in a scene it must be attached to a scene-node that is in the scene graph. In other words, isAttached() and SceneNode.isInSceneGraph() must both be true.

        Returns:
        True if isAttached() and this parent's SceneNode.isInSceneGraph() both return true. Otherwise false.
        See Also:
        isAttached(), SceneNode#isInSceneGraph()}

      • setListener

        void setListener(SceneObject.Listener listener)
        Sets a listener for this scene-object.
        Parameters:
        listener - The active listener for this scene-object.

      • getListener

        SceneObject.Listener getListener()
        Gets this scene-object's listener, if one has been set.
        Returns:
        The listener, if any. Otherwise null.
